name: anathan
text: Ol' Honest Abe liked to sit with one leg crossed on his knee while watching serious plays.

name: cryptfiend85
text: And he got really annoyed when he was shot by John Wilkes Booth and had to go to the cemetery.

name: falseprophet
text: He did not pass Go. He did not collect $200.

name: tbtabby
text: Which is weird, because the play he was watching when he was assassinated was a comedy.

name: farqussus
text: I'd be particularly annoyed if someone shot me in the back of the head while I watched a comedy. Particularly.

name: pan-optic
text:
Booth even timed the shot up with the biggest laugh line so the sound would be hidden by the noise of the audience
of course the whole "jump on the stage, yell in latin, and hobble off" bit afterward kind of sinks the stealthy aspect of the plan, but points for effort, right?

name: layzerblade
text: Apparently his original plan was to go out the way he came in, but his way was blocked.

name: dans
text: Also: Booth was planning on stabbing Ulysses S. Grant right after, so I guess he was banking on the play being super involving.

name: afastidioushat
text: I love the look Beef gives to T... all dick and such.

name: catachresis
text: Couldn't have put it better

name: hollis
text: A comment left by hollis was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by aquamuffin, josher, gorrioncita)

name: zapatos
text: I think he looked more like a guy missing part of his face, because he got shot in the head.  Like all dead on the floor, maybe even bonked his noggin on the balcony.  Lost his hat.  Bleeding on his wife.

name: em2
text: OHH SHHIIIIITTTTT!!!!

name: scorpio_nadir
text: It was a derringer; also not that large a caliber to blow his face off. I saw some of that memorabilia stuff at the Smithsonian ages ago.

name: astarael
text:
If I remember correctly, the bullet didn't exit his head. He also didn't die instantly - he was in a coma and died a day(ish?) later. There was hella swelling and his face was pretty grotesque, but not missing.

This is all to say, he could have given Booth a look such as Roast Beef's.

name: damiel_billiams
text: some even got on THE MAYOR

name: ganymedeio
text: NOT THE MAYOR!

name: dtuba
text: all bleed in his hat

name: epicurus
text: It's that thing women do, where they glare at you like you're the rude one for bringing it up.

name: heccibiggs
text: *glare*

name: brokeaccount
text: ...Osteoporosis?

name: gouldgonewild
text: A comment left by gouldgonewild was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by hateandwar, goocifer, aquamuffin)

name: deusoma
text: ba dum tish.

name: gouldgonewild
text: P.S. - It has been Lupus once now.

name: mugi
text: Preposterous.

name: soup_alex
text: Assetbar's greatest failure to date is that it will not let me both chubby and lame this joke.

name: honesttom
text: Not only was his evening ruined, he had to make his own way to the cemetery. How sad.

name: clever-nickname
text: A comment left by clever-nickname was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Overmedicated, erincandy, Talbain, Jesus, ravindra108, Fcannon, Zem)

name: lrosetw8
text: How are they steering? Do they like make a path of crumbs for the Roombas beforehand?

name: phthoggos
text:
There are remote controls.

Philippe is standing on them.

name: taidje_khan
text: Panel 6: "Dang it, now I have to go to the cemetary."

name: starman11
text: I wish that was how people died. All "goddammit, one more thing to have to do." I can see myself sitting with recently-dead friends at a bar, them going "yeah... now I gotta go in and get embalmed tomorrow, and then I've got the funeral Friday... ugh. Always one more goddamn thing. SIGH"

name: semiquaver
text: "Always one more goddamn thing."  This is the best thing to say after you die.

name: mattylite
text: I picture it like Harry Dean Stanton near the beginning of Fire Walk With Me , where he's all "See, that's just more shit I gotta do."

name: zapatos
text: Like when you're playing Capture the Flag, and you have to walk to the prison.

name: bourbonsamurai
text: This is the best of the Roomba strips.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Weekend Blogs (Friday - Sunday)

Ray: Kind of a Hawaiian Thing!
Roast Beef: Manlyhoodstyle
Pat: I thought I respected Robert; I guess I do not.
Teodor: Am I Blind?
Onstad: County Fair

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Philippe: President stuff.
Mr. Bear: Silly me.
Lyle: golden bear
Onstad: I do not appreciate this.
Little Nephew: Nasty!

name: jthm_guitarist
text:
I love how Beef always puts on a shirt and tie no matter what 'movie' it is.
Another one that made me laugh out loud.

name: chachibenji
text: John Wilkes Booth doesn't care, all hand on his hip, expression not changing. This is how I imagine it in history as well.

name: solobuttons
text:
<-- THE
CEMETERY

name: derelictman
text:
This reminds me of an early Monty Python skit. John Cleese is interviewing a very old man in a garden, and in the time it takes Cleese to say the man's ridiculously long name, the man dies. Cleese then irritably gets up, fetches a shovel and starts digging a grave. As though that's the thing you do.

It's hilarious if you see it.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: Johann Gambolputty de von Ausfern-schplenden-schlitter-crasscrenbon-fried-digger- dingle-dangle-dongle-dungle-burstein-von-knacker-thrasher-apple-banger-horowitz-ticolensic-grander-knotty-spelltinkle-grandlich-grumblemeyer-spelterwasser-kurstlich-himbleeisen-bahnwagen-gutenabend-bitte-ein-nürnburger-bratwustle-gerspurten-mitz-weimache-luber-hundsfut-gumberaber-shönedanker-kalbsfleisch-mittler-auchervon Hautkopft of Ulm

text:
dang. cut off. once more, with feeling!!

name: nouveauboheme
text: when i die i want to be taken to the cemetary by way of roomba motorcade,

name: scion
text: From this strip forward into the entirety of my life, I will only watch films produced by such as a Roomba.

name: milo
text: VROOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO

name: carlyle
text: That's about how I remember it.

name: carlyle
text: Also, Beef's tiny arms.

name: lolsworth
text: "Man what the hell I was just trying to enjoy this hilarious play what is your problem"

name: mal3
text: Well, other than that, Mrs. Lincoln...how was the play?
